main_definition: To fail to win or be victorious in a competition, game, or other contest; also used metaphorically to indicate misplacing something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not winning a game or match
meanings_and_examples.example: The team is losing by two goals at halftime.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Failing to achieve success in an endeavor or competition
meanings_and_examples.example: She didn't lose the race, but she came very close to winning it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Misplacing something and being unable to find it
meanings_and_examples.example: I lost my keys this morning when I was getting ready for work.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To decrease in amount or value; reduce
meanings_and_examples.example: The company is losing money due to the recent economic downturn.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Feeling a loss of enthusiasm or energy
meanings_and_examples.example: After many years working at this job, he has lost his passion for it.
